reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can easily understand why this small two star hotel had once made it to the top ten among members. It is less than a hundred yards from the Place De Madelaine, and for those readers who know Paris, that it an excellent location. The rooms are not that large, the towels could be thicker, and there is no elavator for the three floors(staff will help with luggage), and those are the downside. The rest is more than adequete and an absolutely great value. A hidden gem with an extremely helpful staff and a good breadfast. The street is rather quiet and make sure you try to avoid staying in the room on the same floor as the receptionist area. I have stayed in five star hotels and this property is more than acceptable.
reviews.title: Amazing best location and value
Charming
reviews.text: We stayed three nights three nights at the La Sanguine at the start of our honeymoon. We had had the hotel recommended to us and weren't disappointed. Our room was small, but was comfortable and spotless. The service and staff were fantastic - we felt very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfasts were delightful with home baked pastries. One afternoon, the proprietor brought us out some pain au chocolat straight outof the oven. Delicious. The location is unbeatable. Highly recommended and great value for money.

reviews.title: Very Friendly as Advertised!
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from a Friday to a Thurs. at the beginning of June and although check in wasn't until the afternoon they were more than happy to accomodate myself and my wife for an early morning check in (10AM) by getting our room ready ahead of time which only took about 10minutes. The entire staff morning and night are very friendly so no need to worry about unhelpful or rude parisian staff. The location is absolutely fantastic so would have to say that you can't beat the central location of the hotel especially if you're interested in checking out sites related to the DaVinci Code (note that Jean Cocteau was a former patron of the hotel!). Finally the only negative feedback I would have to say is that our room was opposite the front desk and although I was happy with the entire room, cleanliness etc. I would recommend staying on the other floors to avoid hearing folks checking in/out in the morning and night. Note that there is only one room in this situation and the staff had asked if I wanted to change rooms but seeing as I had finally settled into my atmosphere (I have trouble sleeping in new locations so nothing to do with the hotel itself) I opted to not change rooms. Overall would recommend and note that when comparing hotels on this site this is a way above average 2star locale!!!!

Location good, AC cold, beds comfy, street quiet @ night, owners friendly and breakfast yummy. . Hot chocolate, chocolate croissants, fresh bread, and good coffee! Not too expensive for us and our two teenagers in two rooms, esp. for the area. Refrig in room was nice, esp. once we found a little store around the corner to get water for .75 instead of 2.0 or 3.0 from the mini bar. Close to opera Metro so we walked with luggage to get to airport. Only a couple of things missing: little courtyard/ garden to sit in and relax over coffee, and an ice machine, something Europeans don't seem to need. :)
reviews.title: nice, convenient, comfy

reviews.text: The hotel is very basic and the room is small. If you have lots of luggages, you will have to carry them up the flight of stairs as there is no elevator. Other than that the location is very central, and convenient - the Louvre and Museum Orsay are all within walking distance as are the departmental stores and food stores like Fauchon and Hediard. The main attraction I feel about this hotel is the very friendly hotel owners and staff which makes the place very personal and gives that special touch that you do not get at the more luxurious hotel. As we were leaving the hotel without breakfast, the owner packed some Madelines that he baked for my daughters - that was so very sweet of him.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in great location

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Sanguine. We were looking for small hotel experience, family-run, clean, quaint, very "Paris". After reading the reviews, we found the Sanguine. We found alll those things, but our room was just way too small, probably about 3x3 meters, including the bathroom. I assume that this room was once without bath, which would have been manageable, but for two people it was too small (I literally had to lie on the bed or go in the bathroom, while my wife was getting dressed.) The view was an air shaft. We had a fourth floor room (no elevator). The fourth floor ceiling are only about 7 feet high while the lower floor seemed more reasonable. There was one very strong a/c which worked great, but it was noisy and hard to adjust in such a small room, it was great to cool down the room, but we certainly couldn't sleep with it at night. The bathroom was tiny, with a shower curtained stall shower.
reviews.title: Clean, nice, good location, but room was too small

reviews.text: On the other hand, the entire hotel was incredibly clean, the staff was very nice. We had breakfast one morning, and the owners told us about the special jam and fruits. There was always someone at the desk. The hotel is a couple hundred meters from the Madelaine Metro stop, which was great, but because of 7 crosswalks took at least 5 minutes to walk to. The neighborhood is very upscale and we walked to lots of places like the Place de la Concorde, Tueleries, Orangerie, Opera, all less than 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Just all right for price and location
Good but not worth a a #5 on Trip Advisor
reviews.text: I feel bad writing what is a somewhat negative review, I imagine if we had gotten a bigger room, on floor 2 and 3, we would have been a lot happier, but was told on booking that they were not available. I do wonder about that, since we never saw more than a dozen others altogether during the 3 days were there. But we didn't get such a room, so I have to base my review on what we experienced. Also, according to price list, these rooms were significantly more expensive.

Our only other experience in Paris was a 4 star hotel that we got at a discount which didn't have the character of this hotel, the location, the ambience, but our room was beautiful, at least 3 times the size and we paid about the same rate. Perhaps, if someone insists on a larger room on a lower floor for a lower price, I could recommend this hotel, but otherwise I could not.
